intro: Parnassia californica, commonly known as the California crowfoot, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae, which includes buttercups and other flowering plants. The plant features a basal rosette of heart-shaped leaves and produces clusters of white, star-shaped flowers with prominent yellow centers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodland floors and stream banks. Its botanical characteristics make it a distinctive and ecologically important component of its native habitat.
